titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Harry George Jacklin was born in Australia in 1864. He emigrated to the United States and was naturalized as a citizen in 1893. He served in the Merchant Marine from 1881 to 1883 and in 1883 he joined the U.S. Navy. During his career in the U.S. Navy he served on a number of ships, including the Lackawanna, the Bennington, the Sylph, the USS Caesar, and the USS Celtic. In 1911 he was assigned to duty at the Philadelphia Navy Yard where he served as Chief Boatswain.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of personal papers documenting Harry Jacklin's career in the U.S. Navy. Materials include correspondence to and from Jacklin regarding his naval service between 1904 and 1930; continuous service certificates, 1883-1902; appointment certificates; certificates of discharge, 1881-1893; Jacklin's baptismal, naturalization, marriage, and death certificates; a photo of Jacklin with two fellow officers; and miscellaneous items of ephemera.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
